title: Old-age dependency ratio by state and union territory in India 2011
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The minimum State And Union Territory Delhi has got 1.88 times less Old-age dependency ratio than the maximum State And Union Territory Kerala.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The minimum State And Union Territory Delhi has got 1.88 times less Old-age dependency ratio than the maximum State And Union Territory Kerala.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing State And Union Territory, and Old-age dependency ratio in each State And Union Territory on the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The difference of Old-age dependency ratio between the highest and lowest State And Union Territory is 9.2.
State And Union Territory Kerala is higher than any other State And Union Territorys with value 19.6, followed by , and Tamil Nadu. Down to State And Union Territory Delhi with the lowest value 10.4.
State And Union Territory Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and Odisha have a similar Old-age dependency ratio that is 15.4.
The highest value 19.6 at Kerala is almost 1.39 times larger than the average value 14.09.
